comments.comment: such an amazing first concert experience! i've never seen a scarier thing than cutw.

great mix of tunes. Music was flawless but the lighting and effects were absolutely incredible. It was just... perfectly in sync with the music. The light show was almost just as much art as the music. Incredible, unbelievable are the only things to come to mind.

How am I the first person to comment on this show!? What an amazing set. I've seen them 4 times now including the imfamous Oxford show in 2001 and I think this is the best I've ever seen them. The band seemed to be in a really great mood and the sound was incredible. Love the all LED stage too.
Pyramid Song, Paranoid Android, Dollars & Cents and Street Spirit was an incredible string of performances. By the time they played Just I knew it was the best set by them I'd ever seen.

Astounding! At some point Thom says "thats show biz, the dirty fuck". I really think that he's most happy playing in Jersey. Still too many mind-expolding moments of this show to recall. When do you see someone play live better than they record? Yep, again tonight.

First night of my back to back nights and it was all i could hope for, as usual. 15 Step is a money opener, and to hear: Optimistic,CUTW,HTDC,D&C, and especially Cymbal Rush. My first time getting a live listen to the song. Well done setlist, enough old and new to balance well.
The crowd/atmosphere at the festival was great. There was a fair amount of singing, dancing, and smoking. Being able to turn around to see the Statue of Liberty and the NYC Skyline was pretty awesome. My first time to this park and it really is full of breathtaking views.
Festival was overall well done, easy transportation and plenty of things to do or eat.
Great Set list, Great Atmosphere, and Great Views. I can't wait for tomorrow night

First time seeing Radiohead and without question one of the most intense live shows I've ever experienced. Pleasant surprises included Lucky, Idioteque, Climbing up the Walls and How to Completely Disappear. The 1st encore was an amazing 5 song punch especially Pyramid Song and Paranoid Android being back to back. Really genius way to structure a setlist, they know how to keep the mood changing from song to song.

Freaking awesome of course. Is it me or did they seem just a tad...sloppy? I detected a few bum guitar and organ notes. Made it feel alternately refreshingly loose and lazily bored. They're effortlessly awesome nonetheless. The stage setup alone is worth the price of admission!
